Comments_List: I learned a lot about evaluating primary sources and economic data. I have never taken an economic history class before so it was definitely very interesting to see how one can use economic data in history research.
This class provides unique insight into the Soviet unions economic development throughout the 20th century stretching from the Tsarist period until the collapse of the Soviet Union.
The discussions were strong and the professor was very knowledgeable. I just think that the class could have benefitted from having more people in it.
One weakness was the small class size (6). This class was too small for dynamic discussions to occur naturally so sometimes it felt that conversation was forced rather than free flowing.
Yes, I would recommend it. You will learn a lot and Professor Antonov is a wonderful teacher. Russian history is fascinating and studying it in the context of a seminar is ideal.
